title: The bad husbands reformation, or, The ale-wives daily deceit. If thou in folly thus proceed, what e're you earn to spend; when thou art in the greatest need, one groat they will not lend. To the tune of, My life and my death; or, The poor mans counsellour. This may be printed, R.P.
publisher: Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby, at the Golden-Ball in Pye Corner, near West-Smithfield,
